publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4285 Shiona Baird: Renewable Energy - UK in the Dock—That the Parliament notes with concern that the United Kingdom (UK) is one of eight European countries facing legal proceedings for failing to support renewable energy properly; points out that, while it is the UK facing legal action, responsibility for renewable energy is wholly devolved to the Scottish Parliament, and therefore calls on the Scottish Executive to take immediate action to ensure full compliance with European legislation on renewable energy. Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support
S2M-4285 Renewable Energy - UK in the Dock (lodged on 25 April 2006) Donald Gorrie*

S2M-4285 Shiona Baird: Renewable Energy - UK in the Dock—That the Parliament notes with concern that the United Kingdom (UK) is one of eight European countries facing legal proceedings for failing to support renewable energy properly; points out that, while it is the UK facing legal action, responsibility for renewable energy is wholly devolved to the Scottish Parliament, and therefore calls on the Scottish Executive to take immediate action to ensure full compliance with European legislation on renewable energy. Supported by: Donald Gorrie
